OOC:  They have the main reactor, which was shut down when the ship landed, and the emergency power systems are still running, mostly to provide light.

Alex Sell <kraftlos@...> wrote:Celeron found a series of network components that were running to the
storage room.  He followed the cords and made sure that they were not
running to anything vital.  Then he carefully removed them.

As he was leaving the room he accidentally bumped a pannel in the
wall, some wiring fell out of the wall.  It looked like this had never
been used for anything, they had plastic insulator caps on them.  So
he these wires as well.

He returned to the room with the computer and got to work making final
preparations to get the computer system online.

OOC: Do they have a power generator?


On Mon, 18 Oct 2004 13:14:43 -0700 (PDT), robert riley
<bustercross365@...> wrote:
> 
> OOC:  The interior is as follows: the control area at the front of the ship
> is about the size of a bedroom.  There is a hall passing two rooms of
> bedroom size, and actual bedroom and storage room.  At the end of the hall
> there is another average sized room, that is the engine and power area, the
> back wall is all intruments and access panels.  
>  
> Hellplague:
>  
> The Sweep commander followed after Celeron, mostly to make sure he was doing
> what he was supposed to.  Also to keep from going to sleep, lest he escape.
> 
> Alex Sell <kraftlos@...> wrote:
> 
> 
> Celeron managed to get enough parts together to make a replacement
> interface card, he got halfway through making another card when he ran
> out of parts.  He decided to get to work on the network hub and leave
> the for later.  The hub had not been damaged severely and most of it
> was repaired by simple rewiring, but he still needed more parts.  So
> he went out of the room and this time started exploring further into
> the ship than he had before.....
> 
> OOC: How big is this ship?
> 
> 
> 
> "NOW... YOU'RE FINISHED! FINAL... FLASH!"
>
